Content: It was interesting last year,  there were several very vocal KMD holders practically demanding that NN candidate buy their votes by allowing them to receive a cut of the mining rewards.  It is all there in Bitcoin talk forum.  P Trump was one whale who displayed inordinate amounts of ownership privilege.

We plan to give back to active community members...

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
Im just gonna be clear, ANY community or VOTER based rewards post election are fantastic.  They foster Community, long term interest and a reminder that things happen in teh ecosystem.
What I think sucks is "Hey man, you got any Vote2019 tokens to sell me?   Buying X amount for Y KMD."  That just sucks.  Doesn't mean I can do anything about it but I can talk about it.

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I agree with what @Deleted User is saying

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: It can be but we're just a few weeks out, don't want to be overly ambitious

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I'm just saying that in the last year, we've received a lot of criticism about dPoW and notary nodes being centralized

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: We need to try to fight the FUD

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Yeah I think that's one concern, if team members are running a majority of nodes, it gives critics a lot of ammo against us

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: In the marketing team's minds, the NN should be something we promote far and wide to bring in new devs to the ecosystem, try to grow, try to get new talented people involved

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
`I'm just saying that in the last year, we've received a lot of criticism about dPoW and notary nodes being centralized, controlled by the Komodo team....`
üëÜ This is my concern mainly and this vote issue is just one giant opening in the armor.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: I actually think Team members running on solid platforms can strengthen the ecosystem.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: They provide themselves with more funding to work on KMD that much more.

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I realize that the NN operators are important for the security of the ecosystem so they need to be somewhat trusted but we should also consider this as an opportunity to demonstrate how open the ecosystem is and try to get more people to join our ranks

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: We hope to do Something Similar Emmanuel.

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content:
Yeah I agree guys @Deleted User @FishyGuts 

There have been some good examples of new-ish people getting involved and contributing a lot to the KMD ecosystem

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Would just like to see more of that

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: More free market competition, if you will

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Not just rent-seeking

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
At any rate, we will run for 2 nodes with node rewards distributed to KMD projects and ecosystem contributors. 
Our platform is privacy and legitimate privacy enabled ecommerce.
Only 20% of the rewards are going to go to the operator, and lets hope KMD holds these price levels or that will drop due to server costs üòõ

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Even if nothing changes this year, I am glad that you guys acknowledge and talk about it openly.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
I'm making no secret about voting a few Komodoshis for @Alright and LAbS Notary node.   We're giving 5% of our node earnings each month to them for notarization costs, if we win.  While it won't save them, every little bit helps.
Joker, Alright and the crew were used to get Pirate safe & sound and we are grateful. It's the least we could do.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Automatically syncs with the Gitbook
It does not matter if I edit it or someone from the community edits it.
All changes are visible on public Git commits
I don't think if anyone messes with this process, that person can just get away with it without taking their actions responsibility.
Hence my preference of Github websites
